Summary I've had the good fortune of a rewarding career as an engineer, entrepreneur, developer advocate and a manager of both small and large distributed teams (100+ engineers spread across US, UK and Beijing, China) thus far. Early in my career my main focus was telecom, and I've worked on building systems in most part of the telco network (switching, routing, mobile, middleware, core and access). After joining Google, I worked at YouTube helping to build a developer ecosystem around the YouTube API platform in the media/entertainment space.  
Right now I am interested in working on things that matter. My primary focus is developer ecosystem around Google Search. My goal is to help developers build smarter apps with machine intelligence to delight their users. I've participated on startup developments, corporate applications and also, on architecture specifications and implementations. I also have expertise with developing to cloud environment, mainly with Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services. 
 
Besides the technical skills, I have experience on delivering presentations and speeches to large audiences on the major brazilian and international Java conferences. The presentation topics includes Android, Cloud and APIs in general. The presentations were in Devoxx (Belgium), JavaOne (San Francisco) and on the major Brazilian events like The Developer's Conference, JavaOne Brazil, QConf and others. And also, several participatios on community events, promoted by JUGs, Universities and GDGs.

The main goal is to help Brazilian developers being successful and drive platform adoption. To reach these goals, I have some duties: 
 
* Record technical videos about Android and other Google technologies. Playlists: Design Bytes, DevBytes, Android 4.4 and Next Level Tips

At the present time, working on a international project, building a mobile social network to the Kyokushin Karate members, with free and paid contents, videos, and friends feed. Mobile Developer Senior Vostu November 2010  –  April 2011  (6 months) Worked on the beginning of the mobile games area in the company and helped on choosing the platform to develop the first mobile game (Rede do Crime, already published on Android Market). Active participation on discussions about the creation of a new "mobile only" game, also responsible to research and suggest cross-platforms game development solutions. Senior Developer Movile January 2010  –  September 2010  (9 months) Movile is a mobile software developer and services provider, with eleven years on the market, with a great portfolio including interactive services, sms services, wap portals, software for mobile phone, etc. As a developer, my duties included:

Working on the mobile client with Java ME technology and on server side with Java EE. 
Social networks integration (Twitter, Facebook and Orkut). Developer II Instituto Nokia de Tecnologia July 2008  –  January 2010  (1 year 7 months) INdT is a non-profit R&D center, related to Nokia. The results of the applied research and development results in substantial value generation to the customers and into a faster time to market to products and services. Acting as a developer, my duties included: 
Responsible for R & D of mobile widgets and then by spreading the technology within the institute. Active participation in the creation of 5 widgets for the global launch of the device Nokia N97 (architecture, integration and development) and also the full development of the widget for social network MySpace. 
Developer on a project that aims to help patients with HIV have a better adherence to treatment using an application developed in Java (both client and server). For this project we defined all the architecture of communication between the server and mobile due to special needs such as communication via SMS and support the high demand for it is a social network focused on the patient. Projects Coordinator Simova April 2008  –  June 2008  (3 months) Responsible about R&D of new projects or prototypes and solutions to improve stable applications, like compacting data or rebuilding user interface. So, the integration area is responsible to study the interfaces between systems and make they communicate. Acting as a integration analyst, my duties included:

Develop Oracle stored procedures and SAP ABAP codes to make these interfaces. Technical Leader Softway January 2006  –  September 2007  (1 year 9 months) The software factory is responsible for the creation and maintainence of Softway's softwares and it's divided by development cells for each company product. Making team chronograms, activities planning and allocation, negotiation deals with others areas/teams.

Study of technical impacts on software changes and new features. Developer Softway January 2004  –  January 2006  (2 years 1 month) Working as a developer on the special regime development cell, my roles were:

The Developer Relations organization helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do. Our focus is on supporting third party developers who build applications and businesses on Google's platforms. Developer Advocates act as passionate advocates for Google technologies and are vocal champions for developer interests within Google. This is a position for engineers who love connecting with developers. You also communicate internally with Product Managers. Your work fosters a community of developers working with Google technologies and helps to drive strategy around Developer Relations. 
 
Responsibilities 
Work with the top Android, iOS, and web app developers to build exciting new integrations with Google's latest products. 
Work with partners one-on-one in an engineering capacity in order to design, build, and launch new features. 
Conceive new features and ideas that can change how users interact with apps and Google, and help developers build them. 
Take regular, engineering-focused meetings with developers to help them design new systems, fix bugs, improve UX, and solve complex code problems at a scale of millions of users. 
Work on the core source code of Google's products with other engineers to identify, reproduce, and/or fix bugs that are affecting top developers.
